titleStmt.title: Heauen opened VVherein the counsaile of God concerning mans saluation is yet more cleerely manifested, so that they that haue eyes may come and se the Christian possessed and crowned in his heauenly kingdome: which is the greatest and last benefit we haue by Christ Iesus our Lord. Come and see. First, written, and now newly amended and enlarged, by Mr. William Cowper, minister of Gods word.
titleStmt.author: Cowper, William, 1568-1619.

titleStmt.title: Heauen opened VVherein the counsaile of God concerning mans saluation is yet more cleerely manifested, so that they that haue eyes may come and se the Christian possessed and crowned in his heauenly kingdome: which is the greatest and last benefit we haue by Christ Iesus our Lord. Come and see. First, written, and now newly amended and enlarged, by Mr. William Cowper, minister of Gods word.
titleStmt.author: Cowper, William, 1568-1619.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Thomas Snodham for Thomas Archer and are to be sould at his shop in Popes-head Pallace,

notesStmt.note: In three parts, each with separate dated title page; registers and pagination are continuous.
Part 2 title page has "Iohn Budge" in imprint.
Reproduction of the original in the Central Library, Bristol.
